Another then second-lieutenant, destined to see many more armies; U.S. Grant, also thought highly of them: Ã¢â‚¬ËœThe rank and file were probably inferior Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ to the volunteers that participated in all the later battles of the war; but they were brave men, and then drill and discipline brought out all there was in them.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Philip Katcher writes the story of the regulars and volunteers who fought in the Mexican-American War, detailing the infantry, cavalry, artillery and staff of both the American and Mexican armies
